intro: Goldfussia oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved goldfussia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Goldfussia oligocephala is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
